ACT
50
Interpretation of the will
The provisions of the will must be interpreted according to the testator's true intention.
In case of doubt about the true intention of the testator, one should stick to what is more favorable for the testator, not the legal heir.
In case of doubt about the true intention of the testator, one should stick to what is more favorable for the person who is burdened with something by the will.
